Dear Romell G Green:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel, at (616) 204-
6992.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Staff qualifications; volunteer, contractors on central registry
Title
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12206
Section • (2) A staff member must be of responsible character and
Description suitable and able to meet the needs of children and families
served by the agency.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation During a visit with a youth on 1/24/25 foster care worker engaged
in a physical altercation with youth.
Investigation Complainant was interviewed via telephone on February 6,
2025. Complainant stated they had no additional information.
Child Caring Institution Youth Lead (CCI YL) was interviewed
via video conference on February 6, 2025. She reported Foster
Care Worker (FCW) arrived at the facility at approximately 5pm for
a visit with Youth A. CCI YL stated she was present for the entire
meeting between FCW and Youth A. The meeting seemed to be
going well initially. At one point FCW informed Youth A she would
not be taking her on an outing that day. Youth A became upset
because she assumed they would be going on an outing. Youth A
told CCI YL to “let this bitch out”. CCI YL had been sitting down
and got up to let FCW out because she could see Youth A was
starting to become agitated. Youth A was walking behind her and
repeated “let this bitch out”. FCW ask “this what” and Youth A
repeated “this bitch”. CCI YL stated FCW said something in
response, but she couldn’t recall what she said. CCI YL let FCW
out the first door and then the second door. When they
approached the door where FCW would be exiting Youth A had
CCI YL’s arm and was stating “let this bitch out” and FCW said
“I’m not Vista Maria staff. I can hit you”. FCW and Youth A were
becoming closer and CCI YL was standing in the middle and
trying to keep them away from each other. Youth A had calmed
down slightly but FCW continued to be upset and stated, “let me
get this bitch, let me get this bitch.”
CCI YL stated Youth A and FCW began swinging at each other,
but she couldn’t recall who swung first. After the incident Youth A
wasn’t upset about the physical altercation but seemed more
upset about not being able to go on an outing. CCI YL stated she
doesn’t believe Youth A had any marks or bruises. She is not sure
whether or not Youth A was actually struck by FCW and she feels
2

she was being hit more since she was in the middle trying to
separate the two of them.
Youth A was interviewed via video conference on February
11, 2025. She stated FCW was her caseworker at the time of the
incident on January 24, 2025, but is no longer her worker. She
stated FCW came for an announced visit with her on January 24,
2025. CCI YL was also present the entire time FCW was at the
facility with her. She stated during the visit with FCW they
discussed the possibility of Youth A leaving Vista Maria. At one
point during the visit, Youth A stated she told FCW she was
making everything bad and called her the “B” word. Youth A
clarified she stated the full word. She said FCW asked her what
she said and Youth A repeated it. She stated toward the end of
the meeting neither she nor FCW were that upset. Once they
exited the room where the visit took place and walked into a
common area she was telling CCI YL to “let this bitch out, let this
bitch out”. She stated FCW said “I’m not Vista Maria staff I can put
my hands on you”. FCW started to hit her and was calling her a
bitch while swinging at her. Youth A stated she never lifted her
hands toward FCW or made any attempt to hit her. Youth A stated
she didn’t have any marks or bruises as a result of the altercation.
She clarified FCW was swinging at her but never made contact
with her because CCI YL was in between them and she believes
she was hit.
Foster Care worker (FCW) was interviewed via telephone on
February 11, 2025. She stated she conducted a face-to-face visit
with Youth A at Vista Maria on January 24, 2025. Due to Youth
A’s previous behavior, there is supposed to be another 2 staff
present but on the day of her visit there was only 1 staff from Vista
Maria present. She clarified Youth A has a history of physical
aggression toward staff and other youth. FCW stated she didn’t
question why there was only 1 staff from Vista Maria present
instead of 2 because Youth A had not previously attempted to
become physical towards her.
The meeting was held in a separate room off a common area.
Youth A was sitting on a small, padded mat on the floor and there
was a chair in the room for FCW. FCW stated the meeting started
off fairly well. Youth A told FCW that she would be moving to
another facility the following week. There was some discussion
regarding the upcoming move and the expectations to follow the
rules and keep her hands to herself. Youth A made a comment
about having her dad come up to the facility and beat everyone’s
“ass”. FCW stated no one is trying to fight anyone and attempted
3

to redirect the conversation back to following the rules at the new
facility and then maybe she can have an outing. FCW stated at
that point Youth A started to become agitated and seemed like
she was going to stand up and told FCW to leave. FCW stated
Youth A told CCI YL that she can go ahead and “let this bitch out”.
FCW asked Youth A what she called her and she continued to
repeat you can go ahead and “let this bitch out”. FCW decided to
leave. She stated she walked ahead, CCI YL was behind her and
then Youth A was last. FCW stated she had to wait for CCI YL to
let her out through the door. While they were walking out Youth A
struck FCW in the back of the head. FCW turned around and said,
“I can’t believe you hit me in the fucking head”. FCW isn’t sure if
CCI YL saw Youth A hit her. She thought CCI YL was still
between them, but she didn’t recall seeing CCI YL when she
turned around after being hit in the head. Youth A continued
toward her and FCW put her arm up to maintain separation and
told Youth A not to walk up on her. Once in the common area
FCW stated she was questioning Youth A regarding why she was
responding like that when her intention was to steer her in the
right direction. FCW stated she was upset after being struck and
thought Youth A was going to try and fight her and responded by
swinging at her. She stated she swung at her one time. She
believed Youth A tried to swing at her again, but CCI YL was
between them at that point. She doesn’t recall saying anything at
this point and she doesn’t recall Youth A saying anything.
FCW stated she was surprised by the incident because Youth A
has never hit her before. She stated she has pushed her before.
She reported the previous incident to her supervisor and believed
she filled out an incident report. After the physical altercation, she
reported to FC supervisor that Youth A hit her first. She stated she
feels she and Youth A both made a bad decision and her action
was because of a reaction.
FC supervisor was interviewed via Teams on February 14,
2025. She stated she is FCW’s supervisor. She clarified FCW was
assigned to Youth A’s case since she came into care in November
2023. She stated Youth A has a history of assaultive behavior
towards staff and other youth and there are currently juvenile
charges pending against her for assaulting residential staff.
FC supervisor stated FCW called her after the visit on January 24,
2025, and told her that Youth A had struck her in the back of the
head during her visit. She stated it occurred while she was walking
out the door. FC supervisor advised her to file an incident report
and to go to Concerta to be checked out. She said the
4

conversation was brief. FCW was upset and sounded as though
she was going to start crying but didn’t mention how she
responded or that she had struck Youth A.
FC supervisor stated Vista Maria had previously requested 3:1
staffing for Youth A due to her assaultive behaviors. She stated
during a meeting this week the agency changed the request to
5:1. She stated Vista was rotating staff every 45 minutes to an
hour because Youth A’s behavior was so escalated but there was
1 staff present during FCW’s visit. FCW conducts more visits with
Youth A than required to try and assist. The week of the incident
she visited Youth A approximately 2-3 times. FC supervisor stated
FCW went above and beyond to work with Youth A and maintain a
connection and she believed FCW was upset that Youth A struck
her since she puts in so much effort to work with her.
FC supervisor stated there was a previous incident where Youth A
had shoved FCW. She had advised FCW to file an incident report,
but FCW declined because she wasn’t injured and felt as though
Youth A did not intend to inflict harm on her. FC supervisor stated
she has never had any concerns with FCW. She stated she
witnessed another client verbally berating FCW, and she
maintained her composure the entire time.
Video Reviewed:
• Video footage of January 24, 2025 in a common area at
Vista Maria was reviewed on January 29, 2025. Additional
video footage of January 24, 2025 in a visitation room at
Vista Maria was reviewed on February 14, 2025. Youth A is
sitting on a mat on the floor of visit room with FCW sitting in
a chair. FCW stands up briefly during the visit but is sitting
down the majority of the time. At the conclusion of the visit,
FCW walks out first followed by CCI YL and Youth A is the
last one to walk out. Youth A is seen with her hands at her
side as she walks out of the visit room. They then walk
through another room with a few benches and a TV. FCW
walks out first followed by CCI YL and then Youth A. Once
in the common area FCW turns around and raises her
elbow parallel to the floor with Youth A standing in front of
her. She pushes Youth A with both hands in the chest area
and then is swinging her fist attempting to make contact.
Youth A backs up and appears to raise her hands in more
of a defensive stance while CCI YL is between them
attempting to separate them. The physical interaction
between FCW and Youth A lasts approximately 45 seconds
to 1 minute. At that point, FCW exits the common area.
5

Documents Reviewed:
• Youth A’s MISACWIS case file.
• There is no social work contact entered for January 24,
2025, face-to-face visit between FCW and Youth A.
• January 29, 2025, social work contact. The caseworker
visited with Youth A at her current placement. The
caseworker asked the youth if she would be willing to
discuss the matter that happened between, she and FCW.
Initially, the youth indicated that she had no desire to
discuss the matter. However, she stated that she was mad
at FCW because she "messed everything up when she
brought me here." The caseworker circled back to the
incidents between she and FCW. Youth A then stated that
she "asked her to take her on an outing." However, she
was declined that privilege, and she then instructed the
Vista Maria's staff to get her out of there. FCW indicated
they "stated fighting." The caseworker asked the youth if
she had sustained any injuries, and she responded that she
hadn't. She was also asked which area of her body that she
was hit. The youth stated that she "wasn't hit and that she
never hit FCW." The youth was asked had any incidents of
this sort occurred before. She stated "No. She always nice
to me, take me out to see my siblings, and get me food."
She was also asked if she would like to have FCW back as
a worker and she stated "yes."
• January 25, 2025, Vista Maria incident report.
Quality Manager reviewed the video footage from the date
and time of the incident report. The video shows the
MDHHS staff aggressively push with force the client and
the client then swung with her hands at the worker in an
aggressive manner. The MDHHS staffer and the client
began hitting each other while a Vista Maria staff person
attempted to use her body to create space between both
the MDHHS Staff and the client. The Vista Maria Staff
person created space separating the MDHHS Staff and the
client. The MDHHS staff then walked back to where the
client and the Vista Maria Staff were and was exchanging
more words. The MDHHS staff person walked towards the
exit door and left the wing.
• January 28, 2025, DHHS incident report. FCW went to visit
Youth A. FCW began asking Youth A about her day and
she began to say that she is leaving Thursday. FCW was
able to take pictures of Youth A’s arm from previous
incidents. FCW explained to her to follow directions, and
she could have gone home. Youth A began to tell FCW
6

how she was going to get her father to come up here and
beat a staff member up. FCW explained to her that is not
going to happen, and she needs to learn how to follow
directions. After sitting up there for about 20 minutes FCW
stated that she was about to leave. Youth A said something
to the effect of "yea let this bitch out". FCW said what did
you say and she repeated “let this bitch out”. As FCW was
leaving Youth A walked up to the back of worker and hit her
in the head. FCW asked did you hit me in the head and she
looked at me. Youth A walked up on FCW, FCW put her
elbow in front of her as a guard. Youth A hit worker elbow.
CCI YL was standing between her and worker, so neither
one was able to connect outside of Youth A hitting FCW in
the head while FCW back was turned. This is not the first
incident where Youth A has put her hand on FCW.
Analysis The agency is found in non-compliance as per interviews as well
as video review, FCW engaged in a physical altercation with
Youth A. There is no video evidence to support FCW was acting in
self-defense and Youth A is not seen to raise her hands or arms at
any point during the visit.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
